00055 #define _SYX_INTERP_IN_BLOCK (_syx_interp_state.frame->outer_frame != NULL)
00056 
00057 SyxInterpState _syx_interp_state = SYX_INTERP_STATE_NEW;
00058 
00059 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_CONTEXT
00060 syx_int32 _frame_depth;
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 static syx_uint16 _syx_interp_get_next_byte (void);
00064 static syx_bool _syx_interp_execute_byte (syx_uint16 byte);
00065 
00067 void
00068 _syx_interp_save_process_state (SyxInterpState *state)
00069 {
00070   if (state->frame)
00071     SYX_PROCESS_FRAME_POINTER(state->process) = SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (state->frame);
00072 }
00073 
00074 /* Fetches and updates the execution state of the interpreter to be ready for next instructions */
00075 static void
00076 _syx_interp_state_update (SyxInterpState *state, SyxInterpFrame *frame)
00077 {
00078   SyxOop bytecodes;
00079   SyxOop method = frame->method;;
00080 
00081   state->frame = frame;
00082 
00083   bytecodes = SYX_CODE_BYTECODES (method);
00084   state->arguments = &frame->local;
00085   state->temporaries = state->arguments + SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_CODE_ARGUMENTS_COUNT (method));
00086   state->method_literals = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (SYX_CODE_LITERALS (method));
00087   state->method_bytecodes = (syx_uint16 *)SYX_OBJECT_DATA (bytecodes);
00088   state->method_bytecodes_count = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (bytecodes);
00089 }
00090 
00092 static void
00093 _syx_interp_switch_process (SyxInterpState *state, SyxOop process)
00094 {
00095   SyxInterpFrame *frame;
00096 
00097   if (SYX_OOP_NE (process, state->process))
00098     {
00099       frame = SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (SYX_PROCESS_FRAME_POINTER (process));
00100       _syx_interp_state_update (state, frame);
00101       state->process = process;
00102     }
00103 
00104   state->byteslice = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (syx_processor_byteslice);
00105 }
00106 
00110 void
00111 _syx_interp_frame_prepare_new (SyxInterpState *state, SyxOop method)
00112 {
00113   SyxInterpFrame *frame;
00114   SyxInterpFrame *parent_frame;
00115   syx_int32 temporaries_count;
00116   
00117   parent_frame = state->frame;
00118   /* we need the next position of our frame, the stack pointer is a good point in the process stack */
00119   frame = (SyxInterpFrame *)parent_frame->stack;
00120 
00121 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_CONTEXT
00122   syx_debug ("CONTEXT - New frame %p - Depth: %d\n", frame, ++_frame_depth);
00123 #endif
00124 
00125   frame->this_context = syx_nil;
00126   frame->detached_frame = syx_nil;
00127   frame->parent_frame = parent_frame;
00128   frame->stack_return_frame = parent_frame;
00129   frame->outer_frame = NULL;
00130   frame->method = method;
00131   frame->closure = syx_nil;
00132   frame->next_instruction = 0;
00133 
00134   _syx_interp_state_update (state, frame);
00135 
00136   temporaries_count = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_CODE_TEMPORARIES_COUNT (method));
00137   frame->stack = state->temporaries + temporaries_count;
00138   frame->receiver = state->message_receiver;
00139   memcpy (state->arguments, state->message_arguments,
00140           state->message_arguments_count * sizeof (SyxOop));
00141   memset (state->temporaries, '\0', temporaries_count * sizeof (SyxOop));
00142 }
00143 
00147 void
00148 _syx_interp_frame_prepare_new_closure (SyxInterpState *state, SyxOop closure)
00149 {
00150   SyxInterpFrame *frame;
00151   _syx_interp_frame_prepare_new (state, SYX_BLOCK_CLOSURE_BLOCK (closure));
00152   frame = state->frame;
00153 
00154   frame->outer_frame = (SyxInterpFrame *)SYX_OBJECT_DATA (SYX_BLOCK_CLOSURE_OUTER_FRAME (closure));
00155   frame->receiver = frame->outer_frame->receiver;
00156   frame->closure = closure;
00157 
00158   /* We can't return more if there's no parent frame. See BlockClosure_newProcess primitive for instance. */
00159   if (frame->parent_frame)
00160     frame->stack_return_frame = frame->outer_frame->stack_return_frame;
00161 }
00162 
00164 SyxInterpFrame *
00165 syx_interp_context_to_frame (SyxOop context)
00166 {
00167   if (SYX_IS_NIL (context))
00168     return NULL;
00169 
00170   return (SyxInterpFrame *) SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (SYX_CONTEXT_PART_FRAME_POINTER (context));
00171 }
00172 
00178 SyxOop
00179 syx_interp_frame_to_context (SyxOop stack, SyxInterpFrame *frame)
00180 {
00181   SyxOop context;
00182   SyxOop arguments;
00183 
00184   if (!frame)
00185     return syx_nil;
00186 
00187   if (!SYX_IS_NIL (frame->this_context))
00188     return frame->this_context; 
00189   
00190   syx_memory_gc_begin ();
00191   /* FIXME: they're not accessible for GC troubles.
00192      Do we need to access them with primitives or do we need to detach the frame when
00193      created using enter_context? */
00194   arguments = syx_nil;
00195 
00196   if (!SYX_IS_NIL (frame->closure))
00197     {
00198       context = syx_block_context_new (frame->closure, arguments);
00199       SYX_CONTEXT_PART_STACK (context) = frame->detached_frame;
00200     }
00201   else
00202     {
00203       context = syx_method_context_new (frame->method, frame->receiver, arguments);
00204       SYX_CONTEXT_PART_STACK (context) = stack;
00205     }
00206   SYX_CONTEXT_PART_FRAME_POINTER (context) = SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (frame);
00207   frame->this_context = context;
00208   syx_memory_gc_end ();
00209 
00210   return context;
00211 }

00218 void
00219 syx_interp_init (void)
00220 {
00221 }

00228 void
00229 syx_interp_quit (void)
00230 {
00231 }
00232 
00239 syx_bool
00240 syx_interp_swap_context (SyxOop process, SyxOop context)
00241 {
00242   SyxInterpState _state = SYX_INTERP_STATE_NEW;
00243   SyxInterpFrame *frame = syx_interp_context_to_frame (context);
00244   SyxInterpState *state;
00245 
00246   if (!frame)
00247     return TRUE;
00248 
00249   if (SYX_IS_NIL (process) || SYX_IS_NIL (context))
00250     return FALSE;
00251 
00252   if (SYX_OOP_EQ (process, _syx_interp_state.process))
00253     state = &_syx_interp_state;
00254   else
00255     {
00256       state = &_state;
00257       _syx_interp_switch_process (state, process);
00258     }
00259 
00260   _syx_interp_state_update (state, frame);
00261 
00262   return TRUE;
00263 }
00264 
00270 syx_bool
00271 syx_interp_enter_context (SyxOop process, SyxOop context)
00272 {
00273   SyxOop arguments;
00274   syx_bool reset_parent_frame = FALSE;
00275   SyxInterpState _state = SYX_INTERP_STATE_NEW;
00276   SyxInterpState *state;
00277   SyxInterpFrame *frame;
00278 
00279   if (SYX_IS_NIL (process) || SYX_IS_NIL (context))
00280     return FALSE;
00281 
00282   if (SYX_OOP_EQ (process, _syx_interp_state.process))
00283     state = &_syx_interp_state;
00284   else 
00285     {
00286       state = &_state;
00287       frame = SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (SYX_PROCESS_FRAME_POINTER (process));
00288       /* This is a new Process, reset the parent_frame once we created the frame */
00289       if (SYX_IS_NIL (frame->method))
00290         reset_parent_frame = TRUE;
00291       state->frame = frame;
00292       state->process = process;
00293     }
00294 
00295   arguments = SYX_CONTEXT_PART_ARGUMENTS (context);
00296   if (SYX_IS_NIL (arguments))
00297     state->message_arguments_count = 0;
00298   else
00299     {
00300       state->message_arguments_count = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (arguments);
00301       memcpy (state->message_arguments, SYX_OBJECT_DATA (arguments), state->message_arguments_count * sizeof (SyxOop));
00302     }
00303 
00304   if (SYX_OOP_EQ (syx_object_get_class (context), syx_block_context_class))
00305     _syx_interp_frame_prepare_new_closure (state, SYX_BLOCK_CONTEXT_CLOSURE (context));
00306   else
00307     {
00308       state->message_receiver = SYX_METHOD_CONTEXT_RECEIVER (context);
00309       _syx_interp_frame_prepare_new (state, SYX_CONTEXT_PART_METHOD (context));
00310     }
00311 
00312   if (reset_parent_frame)
00313     state->frame->stack_return_frame = state->frame->parent_frame = NULL;
00314 
00315   state->frame->this_context = context;
00316   SYX_CONTEXT_PART_FRAME_POINTER (context) = SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (state->frame);
00317   _syx_interp_save_process_state (state);
00318 
00319   return TRUE;
00320 }
00321 
00333 syx_bool
00334 syx_interp_leave_and_answer (SyxOop return_object, syx_bool use_stack_return)
00335 {
00336   SyxInterpFrame *return_frame = (use_stack_return
00337                                   ? _syx_interp_state.frame->stack_return_frame
00338                                   : _syx_interp_state.frame->parent_frame);
00339 
00340 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_CONTEXT
00341   syx_debug ("CONTEXT - Leave frame %p for %p - Depth: %d - %s\n", _syx_interp_state.frame, return_frame, --_frame_depth,
00342              (_SYX_INTERP_IN_BLOCK
00343               ? NULL
00344               : SYX_OBJECT_STRING (SYX_METHOD_SELECTOR (_syx_interp_state.frame->method))));
00345 #endif
00346 
00347   SYX_PROCESS_RETURNED_OBJECT(syx_processor_active_process) = return_object;
00348 
00349   _syx_interp_state.frame = return_frame;
00350   if (!return_frame)
00351     {
00352       syx_scheduler_remove_process (syx_processor_active_process);
00353       return FALSE;
00354     }
00355 
00356   _syx_interp_state_update (&_syx_interp_state, return_frame);
00357   syx_interp_stack_push (return_object);
00358   return TRUE;
00359 }
00360 
00367 void
00368 syx_process_execute_scheduled (SyxOop process)
00369 {
00370   syx_uint16 byte;
00371 
00372   _syx_interp_switch_process (&_syx_interp_state, process);
00373 
00374   while (_syx_interp_state.frame && _syx_interp_state.byteslice >= 0)
00375     {
00376       byte = _syx_interp_get_next_byte ();
00377       /* No more frames or somebody wants to yield control to other processes */
00378       if (!_syx_interp_execute_byte (byte))
00379         break;
00380       _syx_interp_state.byteslice--;
00381     }
00382 
00383   _syx_interp_save_process_state (&_syx_interp_state);
00384 }
00385 
00389 void
00390 syx_process_execute_blocking (SyxOop process)
00391 {
00392   SyxInterpState orig_state;
00393   SyxOop orig_process;
00394   syx_uint16 byte;
00395 
00396   SYX_START_PROFILE;
00397 
00398   if (SYX_IS_NIL (process))
00399     {
00400       syx_scheduler_remove_process (process);
00401       return;
00402     }
00403 
00404   orig_process = syx_processor_active_process;
00405   orig_state = _syx_interp_state;
00406 
00407   _syx_interp_save_process_state (&_syx_interp_state);
00408   _syx_interp_switch_process (&_syx_interp_state, process);
00409 
00410   syx_processor_active_process = process;
00411 
00412   while (_syx_interp_state.frame)
00413     {
00414       byte = _syx_interp_get_next_byte ();
00415       _syx_interp_execute_byte (byte);
00416     }
00417   _syx_interp_save_process_state (&_syx_interp_state);
00418 
00419   syx_processor_active_process = orig_process;
00420   _syx_interp_switch_process (&_syx_interp_state, orig_process);
00421 
00422   syx_scheduler_remove_process (process);
00423 
00424   SYX_END_PROFILE(blocking);
00425 }

00430 static SyxInterpreterFunc handlers[] =
00431   {
00432     syx_interp_push_instance,
00433     syx_interp_push_argument,
00434     syx_interp_push_temporary,
00435     syx_interp_push_literal,
00436     syx_interp_push_constant,
00437     syx_interp_push_binding_variable,
00438     syx_interp_push_array,
00439     syx_interp_push_block_closure,
00440 
00441     syx_interp_assign_instance,
00442     syx_interp_assign_temporary,
00443     syx_interp_assign_binding_variable,
00444 
00445     syx_interp_mark_arguments,
00446     syx_interp_send_message,
00447     syx_interp_send_super,
00448     syx_interp_send_unary,
00449     syx_interp_send_binary,
00450 
00451     syx_interp_do_special,
00452     syx_interp_do_extended
00453   };
00454 
00455 static SyxOop *
00456 _syx_interp_find_argument (syx_uint16 argument)
00457 {
00458   SyxInterpFrame *frame = _syx_interp_state.frame;
00459   /* The argument index created by the parser is the totally index of all outer arguments.
00460      So we need to find the right scope by looping trough outer frames and their arguments. */
00461   while (frame)
00462     {
00463       syx_int32 count = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_CODE_ARGUMENTS_COUNT (frame->method));
00464       if (count > argument)
00465         return ((SyxOop *)&frame->local) + argument;
00466       argument -= count;
00467       frame = frame->outer_frame;
00468     }
00469   
00470   /* this shouldn't be reached, maybe a parser fault? */
00471   assert (FALSE);
00472   return NULL;
00473 }
00474 
00475 static SyxOop *
00476 _syx_interp_find_temporary (syx_uint16 temporary)
00477 {
00478   SyxInterpFrame *frame = _syx_interp_state.frame;
00479   /* The temporary index created by the parser is the totally index of all outer temporaries.
00480      So we need to find the right scope by looping trough outer frames and their arguments. */
00481   while (frame)
00482     {
00483       syx_int32 count = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_CODE_TEMPORARIES_COUNT (frame->method));
00484       if (count > temporary)
00485         return ((SyxOop *)&frame->local + SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_CODE_ARGUMENTS_COUNT (frame->method))) + temporary;
00486       temporary -= count;
00487       frame = frame->outer_frame;
00488     }
00489 
00490   /* this shouldn't be reached, maybe a parser fault? */
00491   assert (FALSE);
00492   return NULL;
00493 }
00494 
00495 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_push_instance)
00496 {
00497 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00498   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Push instance at %d\n", argument);
00499 #endif
00500   syx_interp_stack_push (SYX_OBJECT_VARS(_syx_interp_state.frame->receiver)[argument]);
00501   return TRUE;
00502 }
00503 
00504 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_push_argument)
00505 {
00506 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00507   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Push argument at %d\n", argument);
00508 #endif
00509   
00510   if (argument == 0)
00511     syx_interp_stack_push (_syx_interp_state.frame->receiver);
00512   else
00513     syx_interp_stack_push (*_syx_interp_find_argument (argument - 1));
00514   return TRUE;
00515 }
00516 
00517 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_push_temporary)
00518 {
00519 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00520   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Push temporary at %d\n", argument);
00521 #endif
00522   syx_interp_stack_push (*_syx_interp_find_temporary (argument));
00523   return TRUE;
00524 }
00525 
00526 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_push_literal)
00527 {
00528 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00529   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Push literal at %d\n", argument);
00530 #endif
00531   syx_interp_stack_push (_syx_interp_state.method_literals[argument]);
00532   return TRUE;
00533 }
00534 
00535 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_push_constant)
00536 {
00537   SyxOop context;
00538 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00539   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Push constant %d\n", argument);
00540 #endif
00541   switch (argument)
00542     {
00543     case SYX_BYTECODE_CONST_NIL:
00544       syx_interp_stack_push (syx_nil);
00545       break;
00546     case SYX_BYTECODE_CONST_TRUE:
00547       syx_interp_stack_push (syx_true);
00548       break;
00549     case SYX_BYTECODE_CONST_FALSE:
00550       syx_interp_stack_push (syx_false);
00551       break;
00552     case SYX_BYTECODE_CONST_CONTEXT:
00553       context = syx_interp_frame_to_context (SYX_PROCESS_STACK (_syx_interp_state.process),
00554                                              _syx_interp_state.frame);
00555       syx_interp_stack_push (context);
00556       break;
00557     default:
00558       syx_signal (SYX_ERROR_INTERP, syx_string_new ("Unknown constant"));
00559       return FALSE;
00560     }
00561   
00562   return TRUE;
00563 }
00564 
00565 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_push_binding_variable)
00566 {
00567   SyxOop binding;
00568   SyxOop object;
00569 
00570   binding = _syx_interp_state.method_literals[argument];
00571   object = syx_dictionary_bind (binding);
00572 
00573 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00574   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Push binding variable: '%s' -> %d\n",
00575              SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL(SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY(binding)),
00576              SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (binding)));
00577 #endif
00578 
00579   syx_interp_stack_push (object);
00580   return TRUE;
00581 }
00582 
00583 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_push_array)
00584 {
00585   SyxOop array;
00586   syx_uint16 i;
00587 
00588   array = syx_array_new_size (argument);
00589   for (i=1; i <= argument; i++)
00590     SYX_OBJECT_DATA(array)[argument - i] = syx_interp_stack_pop ();
00591 
00592 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00593   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Push array of elements: %d\n", argument);
00594 #endif
00595 
00596   syx_interp_stack_push (array);
00597 
00598   return TRUE;
00599 }
00600 
00601 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_assign_instance)
00602 {
00603 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00604   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Assign instance at %d\n", argument);
00605 #endif
00606   SYX_OBJECT_VARS(_syx_interp_state.frame->receiver)[argument] = syx_interp_stack_peek ();
00607   return TRUE;
00608 }
00609 
00610 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_assign_temporary)
00611 {
00612 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00613   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Assign temporary at %d\n", argument);
00614 #endif
00615   *(_syx_interp_find_temporary (argument)) = syx_interp_stack_peek ();
00616   return TRUE;
00617 }
00618 
00619 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_assign_binding_variable)
00620 {
00621   SyxOop binding;
00622   SyxOop value;
00623 
00624   binding = _syx_interp_state.method_literals[argument];
00625   value = syx_interp_stack_peek ();
00626 
00627 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00628   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Assign binding variable '%s' -> %p\n",
00629              SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL(SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY(binding)),
00630              SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (value));
00631 #endif
00632 
00633   syx_dictionary_bind_set_value (binding, value);
00634   return TRUE;
00635 }
00636 
00637 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_mark_arguments)
00638 {
00639 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00640   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Mark arguments %d + receiver\n", argument);
00641 #endif
00642 
00643   _syx_interp_state.message_arguments_count = argument;
00644   _syx_interp_state.frame->stack -= argument;
00645   memcpy (_syx_interp_state.message_arguments,
00646           _syx_interp_state.frame->stack,
00647           argument * sizeof(SyxOop));
00648 
00649   _syx_interp_state.message_receiver = syx_interp_stack_pop ();
00650   _syx_interp_state.byteslice++; /* be sure we send the message */
00651 
00652   return TRUE;
00653 }
00654 
00655 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_send_message)
00656 {
00657   SyxOop binding;
00658   SyxOop klass, method;
00659   syx_int32 primitive;
00660 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_CONTEXT
00661   syx_int32 depth;
00662 #endif
00663 
00664   SYX_START_PROFILE;
00665 
00666   binding = _syx_interp_state.method_literals[argument];
00667   klass = syx_object_get_class (_syx_interp_state.message_receiver); 
00668   method = syx_class_lookup_method_binding (klass, binding);
00669   SYX_END_PROFILE(send_message);
00670 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00671 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_CONTEXT
00672   putchar('`');
00673   for (depth=0; depth < _frame_depth; depth++)
00674     putchar('-');
00675 #endif
00676   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Send message %s%s#%s\n",
00677              SYX_IS_NIL (SYX_CLASS_NAME (syx_object_get_class (_syx_interp_state.message_receiver)))
00678              ? SYX_OBJECT_STRING (SYX_CLASS_NAME (_syx_interp_state.message_receiver))
00679              : SYX_OBJECT_STRING (SYX_CLASS_NAME (syx_object_get_class (_syx_interp_state.message_receiver))),
00680              SYX_IS_NIL (SYX_CLASS_NAME (syx_object_get_class (_syx_interp_state.message_receiver)))
00681              ? " class"
00682              : "",
00683              SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding)));
00684 #endif
00685 
00686   if (SYX_IS_NIL (method))
00687     {
00688 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00689       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - NOT UNDERSTOOD #%s\n", SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding)));
00690 #endif
00691       return syx_signal_does_not_understand (_syx_interp_state.message_receiver, SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding));
00692     }
00693 
00694   primitive = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_METHOD_PRIMITIVE (method));
00695   if (primitive >= 0 && primitive < SYX_PRIMITIVES_MAX)
00696     return syx_interp_call_primitive (primitive, method);
00697   else if (primitive == -2)
00698     return syx_plugin_call_interp (&_syx_interp_state, method);
00699 
00700   _syx_interp_frame_prepare_new (&_syx_interp_state, method);
00701   return TRUE;
00702 }
00703 
00704 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_send_super)
00705 {
00706   SyxOop binding;
00707   SyxOop klass, method;
00708   syx_int32 primitive;
00709 
00710   binding = _syx_interp_state.method_literals[argument];
00711   klass = SYX_CLASS_SUPERCLASS (SYX_CODE_CLASS (_syx_interp_state.frame->method));
00712   method = syx_class_lookup_method_binding (klass, binding);
00713 
00714 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00715   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Send message #%s to super\n", SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding)));
00716 #endif
00717 
00718   if (SYX_IS_NIL (method))
00719     {
00720 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00721       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - NOT UNDERSTOOD super #%s\n", SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding)));
00722 #endif
00723       return syx_signal_does_not_understand (_syx_interp_state.message_receiver, SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding));
00724     }
00725 
00726   primitive = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_METHOD_PRIMITIVE (method));
00727   if (primitive >= 0 && primitive < SYX_PRIMITIVES_MAX)
00728     return syx_interp_call_primitive (primitive, method);
00729   else if (primitive == -2)
00730     return syx_plugin_call_interp (&_syx_interp_state, method);
00731 
00732   _syx_interp_frame_prepare_new (&_syx_interp_state, method);
00733   return TRUE;
00734 }
00735 
00736 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_send_unary)
00737 {
00738   /*
00739   SyxOop klass, method, context;
00740   syx_int32 primitive;
00741   syx_int32 index;
00742   SyxOop binding;
00743   syx_symbol selector;
00744   
00745   _syx_exec_state->message_receiver = syx_interp_stack_pop ();
00746   index = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (_syx_exec_state->literals[argument]));
00747   binding = SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (_syx_exec_state->literals[argument]);
00748   selector = SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding));
00749 
00750   switch (index)
00751     {
00752     case 0:
00753       #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00754       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Send unary message isNil\n");
00755       #endif
00756       syx_interp_stack_push (syx_boolean_new (SYX_IS_NIL (_syx_exec_state->message_receiver)));
00757       return TRUE;
00758     case 1:
00759       #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00760       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Send unary message notNil\n");
00761       #endif
00762       syx_interp_stack_push (syx_boolean_new (!SYX_IS_NIL (_syx_exec_state->message_receiver)));
00763       return TRUE;
00764     }
00765 
00766   klass = syx_object_get_class (_syx_exec_state->message_receiver);
00767   method = syx_class_lookup_method_binding (klass, binding);  
00768 
00769 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00770   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Send unary message #%s\n", selector);
00771 #endif
00772 
00773   if (SYX_IS_NIL (method))
00774     {
00775 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00776       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - NOT UNDERSTOOD unary #%s\n", selector);
00777 #endif
00778       return syx_signal_does_not_understand (_syx_exec_state->message_receiver, syx_symbol_new (selector));
00779     }
00780 
00781   primitive = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_METHOD_PRIMITIVE (method));
00782   if (primitive >= 0 && primitive < SYX_PRIMITIVES_MAX)
00783     return syx_interp_call_primitive (primitive, method);
00784   else if (primitive == -2)
00785     return syx_plugin_call_interp (_syx_exec_state, method);
00786 
00787     context = syx_method_context_new (_syx_exec_state->context, method, _syx_exec_state->message_receiver, syx_nil);
00788 
00789     return syx_interp_enter_context (context);*/
00790   return 0;
00791 }
00792 
00793 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_push_block_closure)
00794 {
00795   SyxInterpFrame *frame;
00796   syx_int32 frame_size;
00797   SyxOop frame_oop;
00798   SyxOop closure;
00799 
00800   syx_memory_gc_begin ();
00801 
00802   closure = syx_object_copy (_syx_interp_state.method_literals[argument]);
00803 
00804 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00805   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Push block closure %d -> %p\n", argument, SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (closure));
00806 #endif
00807 
00808   syx_interp_stack_push (closure);
00809 
00810   if (!SYX_IS_NIL (_syx_interp_state.frame->detached_frame))
00811     SYX_BLOCK_CLOSURE_OUTER_FRAME(closure) = _syx_interp_state.frame->detached_frame;
00812   else
00813     {
00814       /* Copy up to temporaries */
00815       frame_size = SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (&_syx_interp_state.frame->local, _syx_interp_state.frame) +
00816         SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_CODE_ARGUMENTS_COUNT (_syx_interp_state.frame->method)) +
00817         SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_CODE_TEMPORARIES_COUNT (_syx_interp_state.frame->method));
00818       frame_oop = syx_array_new_ref (frame_size, (SyxOop *)_syx_interp_state.frame);
00819       frame = (SyxInterpFrame *)SYX_OBJECT_DATA (frame_oop);
00820       frame->detached_frame = frame_oop;
00821       /* Detach this frame from the process stack.
00822          The stack pointer will still refer to the process stack */
00823       _syx_interp_state_update (&_syx_interp_state, frame);
00824       /* Update this_context if available */
00825       if (!SYX_IS_NIL (frame->this_context))
00826         {
00827           SYX_CONTEXT_PART_STACK (frame->this_context) = frame_oop;
00828           SYX_CONTEXT_PART_FRAME_POINTER (frame->this_context) = SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (frame);
00829         }
00830       SYX_BLOCK_CLOSURE_OUTER_FRAME(closure) = frame_oop;
00831     }
00832 
00833   syx_memory_gc_end ();
00834   
00835   return TRUE;
00836 }
00837 
00838 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_send_binary)
00839 {
00840   /*
00841   SyxOop klass, method, context, first_argument;
00842   syx_int32 primitive;
00843   SyxOop binding;
00844   syx_int32 index;
00845   syx_symbol selector;
00846 
00847   first_argument = syx_interp_stack_pop ();
00848   _syx_exec_state->message_receiver = syx_interp_stack_pop ();
00849   index = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (_syx_exec_state->literals[argument]));
00850   binding = SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (_syx_exec_state->literals[argument]);
00851   selector = SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding));
00852 
00853   if (index < 8 && SYX_IS_SMALL_INTEGER(_syx_exec_state->message_receiver) && SYX_IS_SMALL_INTEGER(first_argument))
00854     {
00855       switch (index)
00856         {
00857         case 0:
00858           syx_interp_stack_push (syx_small_integer_new (SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(_syx_exec_state->message_receiver) + SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(first_argument)));
00859           return TRUE;
00860         case 1:
00861           syx_interp_stack_push (syx_small_integer_new (SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(_syx_exec_state->message_receiver) - SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(first_argument)));
00862           return TRUE;
00863         case 2:
00864           syx_interp_stack_push (syx_boolean_new (SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(_syx_exec_state->message_receiver) < SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(first_argument)));
00865           return TRUE;
00866         case 3:
00867           syx_interp_stack_push (syx_boolean_new (SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(_syx_exec_state->message_receiver) > SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(first_argument)));
00868           return TRUE;
00869         case 4:
00870           syx_interp_stack_push (syx_boolean_new (SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(_syx_exec_state->message_receiver) <= SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(first_argument)));
00871           return TRUE;
00872         case 5:
00873           syx_interp_stack_push (syx_boolean_new (SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(_syx_exec_state->message_receiver) >= SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(first_argument)));
00874           return TRUE;
00875         case 6:
00876           syx_interp_stack_push (syx_boolean_new (SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(_syx_exec_state->message_receiver) == SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(first_argument)));
00877           return TRUE;
00878         case 7:
00879           syx_interp_stack_push (syx_boolean_new (SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(_syx_exec_state->message_receiver) != SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(first_argument)));
00880           return TRUE;
00881         }
00882     }
00883 
00884   klass = syx_object_get_class (_syx_exec_state->message_receiver);
00885   method = syx_class_lookup_method_binding (klass, binding);
00886 
00887 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00888   syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Send binary message #%s\n", selector);
00889 #endif
00890 
00891   if (SYX_IS_NIL (method))
00892     {
00893 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00894       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - NOT UNDERSTOOD binary #%s\n", selector);
00895 #endif
00896       return syx_signal_does_not_understand (_syx_exec_state->message_receiver, syx_symbol_new (selector));
00897     }
00898 
00899   if (_syx_exec_state->message_arguments)
00900     syx_free (_syx_exec_state->message_arguments);
00901   
00902   _syx_exec_state->message_arguments = (SyxOop *) syx_calloc (1, sizeof (SyxOop));
00903   _syx_exec_state->message_arguments[0] = first_argument;
00904 
00905   primitive = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_METHOD_PRIMITIVE (method));
00906   if (primitive >= 0 && primitive < SYX_PRIMITIVES_MAX)
00907     return syx_interp_call_primitive (primitive, method);
00908   else if (primitive == -2)
00909     return syx_plugin_call_interp (_syx_exec_state, method);
00910 
00911   syx_memory_gc_begin ();
00912   context = syx_method_context_new (_syx_exec_state->context, method, _syx_exec_state->message_receiver,
00913     syx_array_new (1, _syx_exec_state->message_arguments));
00914   syx_memory_gc_end ();
00915   _syx_exec_state->message_arguments = NULL;
00916 
00917   return syx_interp_enter_context (context);*/
00918   return 0;
00919 }
00920 
00921 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_do_special)
00922 {
00923   SyxOop returned_object;
00924   SyxOop condition;
00925   syx_uint16 jump;
00926   SyxOop ensure_block;
00927 
00928   switch (argument)
00929     {
00930     case SYX_BYTECODE_POP_TOP:
00931 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00932       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Pop top\n");
00933 #endif
00934       _syx_interp_state.frame->stack--;
00935       return TRUE;
00936     case SYX_BYTECODE_SELF_RETURN:
00937 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00938       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Self return\n");
00939 #endif
00940       if (_SYX_INTERP_IN_BLOCK)
00941         {
00942           if (!SYX_IS_NIL (_syx_interp_state.frame->this_context))
00943             {
00944               /* check for ensured blocks */
00945               ensure_block = SYX_BLOCK_CONTEXT_ENSURE_BLOCK (_syx_interp_state.frame->this_context);
00946               if (SYX_IS_TRUE (ensure_block))
00947                 {
00948                   /* ensured block has been called,
00949                      so pop its returned object */
00950                   _syx_interp_state.frame->stack--;
00951                   SYX_BLOCK_CONTEXT_ENSURE_BLOCK (_syx_interp_state.frame->this_context) = syx_nil;
00952                 }
00953               else if (!SYX_IS_NIL (ensure_block))
00954                 {
00955                   /* no arguments passed to the ensure block */
00956                   _syx_interp_state.message_arguments_count = 0;
00957                   /* decrease instruction pointer re-execute self-return */
00958                   _syx_interp_state.frame->next_instruction--;
00959                   
00960                   /* set the ensure block to true, so that next time self-return bytecode is executed */
00961                   SYX_BLOCK_CONTEXT_ENSURE_BLOCK (_syx_interp_state.frame->this_context) = syx_true;
00962                   _syx_interp_frame_prepare_new_closure (&_syx_interp_state, ensure_block);
00963                   return TRUE;
00964                 }
00965             }
00966           returned_object = syx_interp_stack_pop ();
00967         }
00968       else
00969         returned_object = _syx_interp_state.frame->receiver;
00970       
00971       return syx_interp_leave_and_answer (returned_object, FALSE);
00972 
00973     case SYX_BYTECODE_STACK_RETURN:
00974 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
00975       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Stack return\n");
00976 #endif
00977 
00978       if (_SYX_INTERP_IN_BLOCK)
00979         {
00980           if (!SYX_IS_NIL (_syx_interp_state.frame->this_context))
00981             {
00982               /* check for ensure blocks */
00983               ensure_block = SYX_BLOCK_CONTEXT_ENSURE_BLOCK (_syx_interp_state.frame->this_context);
00984               if (SYX_IS_TRUE (ensure_block))
00985                 {
00986                   /* ensured block has been called,
00987                      so pop its returned object */
00988                   _syx_interp_state.frame->stack--;
00989                   SYX_BLOCK_CONTEXT_ENSURE_BLOCK (_syx_interp_state.frame->this_context) = syx_nil;
00990                 }
00991               else if (!SYX_IS_NIL (ensure_block))
00992                 {
00993                   /* no arguments passed to the ensure block */
00994                   _syx_interp_state.message_arguments_count = 0;
00995                   /* decrease instruction pointer re-execute self-return */
00996                   _syx_interp_state.frame->next_instruction--;
00997                   
00998                   /* set the ensure block to true, so that next time self-return bytecode is executed */
00999                   SYX_BLOCK_CONTEXT_ENSURE_BLOCK (_syx_interp_state.frame->this_context) = syx_true;
01000                   _syx_interp_frame_prepare_new_closure (&_syx_interp_state, ensure_block);
01001                   return TRUE;
01002                 }
01003             }
01004         }
01005 
01006       returned_object = syx_interp_stack_pop ();
01007 
01008       return syx_interp_leave_and_answer (returned_object, TRUE);
01009     case SYX_BYTECODE_BRANCH_IF_TRUE:
01010     case SYX_BYTECODE_BRANCH_IF_FALSE:
01011 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
01012       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Conditional\n");
01013 #endif
01014       condition = syx_interp_stack_pop ();
01015       jump = _syx_interp_get_next_byte ();
01016       if (!SYX_IS_BOOLEAN (condition))
01017         syx_signal (SYX_ERROR_INTERP, syx_string_new ("Condition must be boolean"));
01018 
01019       /* Check for jump to the other conditional branch */
01020       if ((argument == SYX_BYTECODE_BRANCH_IF_TRUE ? SYX_IS_FALSE (condition) : SYX_IS_TRUE (condition)))
01021         {
01022           syx_interp_stack_push (syx_nil);
01023           _syx_interp_state.frame->next_instruction = jump;
01024         }
01025 
01026       return TRUE;
01027     case SYX_BYTECODE_BRANCH:
01028 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
01029       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Branch\n");
01030 #endif
01031       jump = _syx_interp_get_next_byte ();
01032       if (jump)
01033         _syx_interp_state.frame->next_instruction = jump;
01034 
01035       return TRUE;
01036     case SYX_BYTECODE_DUPLICATE:
01037 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
01038       syx_debug ("BYTECODE - Duplicate\n");
01039 #endif
01040 
01041       syx_interp_stack_push (syx_interp_stack_peek ());
01042       return TRUE;
01043     default:
01044 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_BYTECODE
01045       syx_debug ("BYTECODE ------- UNKNOWN --------\n");
01046 #endif
01047       syx_signal (SYX_ERROR_INTERP, syx_string_new ("Unknown bytecode: %p", argument));
01048       return FALSE;
01049     }
01050 
01051   return TRUE;
01052 }
01053 
01054 SYX_FUNC_INTERPRETER (syx_interp_do_extended)
01055 {
01056   SyxInterpreterFunc handler;
01057   syx_uint16 command = argument;
01058   argument = _syx_interp_get_next_byte ();
01059   handler = handlers[command];
01060   return handler (argument);
01061 }
01062 
01063 static syx_uint16
01064 _syx_interp_get_next_byte (void)
01065 {
01066 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_TRACE_IP
01067   syx_debug ("TRACE IP - Fetch at ip %d bytecode: %u - %p\n", _syx_interp_state.frame->next_instruction, _syx_interp_state.method_bytecodes[_syx_interp_state.frame->next_instruction], _syx_interp_state.frame);
01068 #endif
01069 
01070   return SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_16 (_syx_interp_state.method_bytecodes[_syx_interp_state.frame->next_instruction++]);
01071 }
01072 
01073 static syx_bool
01074 _syx_interp_execute_byte (syx_uint16 byte)
01075 {
01076   syx_uint16 command, argument;
01077   SyxInterpreterFunc handler;
01078 
01079   command = (byte & SYX_BYTECODE_COMMAND_MASK) >> SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_BITS;
01080   argument = byte & SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_MASK;
01081   handler = handlers[command];
01082 
01083   return handler (argument);
01084 }
Documented by Luca Bruno and ScaccoMatto
